All right, so I enjoy playing Irelia a lot, and I have a ton of questions! If you can answer a few (or even one), I'd be stoked.

1. I've been following a guide which says to start W,Q,E then max either W or E depending on whether you're going to have extended trades (against a tanky opponent) or going to be doing more burst (versus a squishy). Q is maxed last. What are your thoughts?
2. When is the best time to roam as Irelia? I know this is kind of broad, but I'm really curious. If I'm winning lane, should I try to destroy the tower before roaming, or push the wave to tower and roam mid? Should I roam if I'm losing lane really hard?
3. What are Irelia's most important powerspikes? I watched one of your videos of you versus an Olaf, and you noted that Olaf has a level two powerspike, whereas Irelia's is at level four. Are there any other notable ones that I should be aware of?
4. How aggressive shoud I be during the laning phase versus a ranged opponent? Should I try to start a trade the moment I hit three, assuming I am lower health than the ranged opponent?
5. How do you deal with Nasus? I'm not sure how much you deal with him at your MMR, but I _hate_ playing against Nasus as Irelia. I hate playing against Nasus as a lot of champions, but I feel really helpless as Irelia. Also, do you think Quicksilver Sash is a smart buy against him for the Wither?
6. What about Pantheon? I don't like going against him either; his trading seems so much better, and it's difficult to avoid his harass.
7. How important is it that Irelia is part of her team when a teamfight happens, as opposed to splitpushing or stopping a split push?
8. You said that there's a possibility for a second damage item in Irelia's build, like a Maw or Blade of the Ruined King. Should I get one of those only when I'm ahead (then go full defensive), and go full defensive after Trinity Force otherwise?
9. Do you start Doran's Blade or Corrupting Potion?

Thanks so much!

1. I'd start Q lvl 1 vs ranged champions, E lvl 1 vs melee champions and then get W last, so Q>E>W or E>Q>W for the first 3 lvls, i max W vs most things and E vs stuff like leblanc if i am mid lane, generally anything that is difficult to auto
2. best time to roam is when you complete trinity force regardless of how fed/behind you are, it allows you to gank through lane relatively easily
3. 4/5/7/9/13 and when you complete trinity are her most important spikes, assuming you max W, if you max E it is 7/9/11+, so tl;dr when your e or w are maxed or both
4. vs a ranged opponent you can actually start at lvl 1, i take q and jump on them get a few autos and walk in the brush to drop creep agro, otherwise its fairly easy to all in them after lvl 4 if you max w, if u max e you might need to wait till lvl 7
5. hes actually fairly easy, a lot of people get mercs but tabi is very good vs him as hes mostly physical damage and hes easy to soften up and all in, though its easiest to kill him pre 6 and snowball the lane from there and roam around while he stacks up, since he forces his team to play a 4v5 while he ramps up pretty much
6. pantheon is very strong pre 6 but after 6 you should have the advantage since his ult doesnt really do anything for him in an all in, so id suggest fighting him post 6
7. its just reliant on you having tp, if you dont have tp you should be with your team, if you have tp feel free to split push
8. you can build damage after trinity if you think that you can get away with it, i personally prefer to get the CDR defensive items when im ahead (randuins if i am behind, anything with hp is great if you are behind) but if u feel like the game will be won anyway feel free to build dmg after trinity
9. i prefer starting dorans blade because its great sustain with her w

1. max Q 2nd if it is most important (against ranged champs) depends on their team!
3. anytime she gets a point in W I think, is considered a power spike
5. watch how to deal with nasus by dong huap on youtube
9. Corrupting potion, definitely

so i got into this post to read, and as soon as i read he got to challenger and also DODGES when his champ gets banned or doesn't get to play. this sickens me, someone who could have 10, 20 or even more dodges can be rewarded is sickening. this needs to be worked on, changed, or at least looked at. people like this shouldn't be rewarded for just waiting a few mins to dodge. i know i am not the greatest player in the world by far, but for the people out there that play this game for entertainment with a mild competitiveness, who don't dodge, don't afk, try to be a team player, and just get shafted because we haven't mastered to get to gold or higher seems a little unnerving that someone who could dodge X amount of times and cry that they don't get the one champ they can play/carry with and get all the challenger rights.
I agree with you. They might be really good at the game, but they should not be featured if they openly admit to dodging in this manner.
Lots of people are saying this but why?  You may respond "Well it's toxic."  Why is it toxic?
It undermines the point of a ranked queue. If you were able to freely dodge every single ranked game where you had an unfavorable match up, then champion select wouldnt be much of a point.

That's invalid, you can't freely dodge every single ranked game.  The LP loss for one is small sure, so you basically get one dodge per game, but the ledge is steep.  I'm not saying that you should be allowed to dodge freely, read the string that I already had with The Anarchit3cht.
"every single ranked game where you had an unfavorable match up" =/= "freely dodge every single ranked game".

Are you saying that as the system stands, you can freely dodge every ranked game with an unfavorable match up?  The semantics don't make a difference when it's the same either way.  The odds that you'll have an unfavorable match up two games in a row aren't so low that it won't happen, and a drop of 13 LP would be enough to make me think twice about dodging again.  I also doubt you read the discussion that has already happened if you're pointing out such a petty conflict.

EDIT: Let me add that you need to state what you believe the point of ranked queue is.  In the rawest form the point would be to advance, would it not?  To see how high you can get.

His statement is that if irelia is picked/banned already, he dodges. So yes, apparently you can dodge every poor matchup.

Pregame lobby is part of the game. An enemy picking/banning your main is supposed to be rewarded by having a much easier game due to you not getting your pick. Thats part of why bans even exist. If you dodge because of this, then they do not receive the reward they should have gotten for banning properly.

I still don't believe you read the other discussion and in exchange for dodging you're losing LP, consecutive dodges increases the LP loss and the timer to a point that you're not even going to get to play that day.  If I get a Blitzcrank mid pick, I'm probably going to dodge, or a Yasuo support.  We are allowed to dodge, and so dodging becomes a tool.  I haven't dodged, but I've been in some situations that I probably should have, and the more I look at it, the more I think I will.  You've also avoided every question I've directed at you and you just keep recycling your ideology rather than making an actual argument.  I'm not going to bother until you actually answer the questions I've posed back at you.

You lose LP in exchange for a dodge is irrelevant; the enemy team didnt receive the boon that they rightfully deserved. And i answered your questions perfectly fine; dodging every single game they dont get irelia is, by definition, dodging every single unfavorable matchup. People with a history of dodging often or a pattern of dodging certain scenarios (such as their one trick being picked/banned) *should* be punished more severely for their dodges. If you get a blitz mid or a yasuo support, deal with it like everyone else in the game. Chances are theyll carry you. Not that it matters, because its not even remotely close to the same issue (a one trick dodging every single unfavorable matchup and not giving the enemy team LP they deserve)

He can play Irelia into an unfavorable match up, he never said he dodged those.  Here's a question you ignored.

"Let me add that you need to state what you believe the point of ranked queue is. In the rawest form the point would be to advance, would it not? To see how high you can get."

You did not answer it.  Since you're obviously not going to read the other thread here's a copy paste for you.  It's literally right above this one.

"I've never dodged a ranked game, but I don't have a problem with people dodging because they're one-trick ponies and they didn't get their champ. In fact, if I'm on the team of a one-trick pony and their champ gets banned, I WANT them to dodge. That way I'm not at a huge disadvantage because of a player that doesn't know how to play whatever champ they picked. I would rather wait an extra 30 seconds then have an ally that doesn't know what they're doing and lose a match as a result. If I already showed my pick to the enemy team, I'll probably back out of queue after they dodge and immediately re queue, so that the enemy team doesn't know my preferred pick. It's also not against the rules. There is a penalty for doing it, but you're allowed to do it. In exchange for some LP loss you can dodge, wait 3 minutes, and then re queue. The penalties are there to prevent from it happening on a mass scale, but I doubt riot minds it happening at the rate that it currently does."

My counterpoint is that it creates a more toxic environment for me to have a player on my team with no idea how to play the champ they picked, and then have the entire team start flaming and blaming him for how the game goes than it is to have someone dodge and wait an extra 30 seconds."

The enemy doesn't deserve a boon if someone dodges.  That's ridiculous.  They didn't do anything to deserve it.  And for your point of properly banning, no one bands properly in solo queue anyway.  They ban OP's or champs they don't want to see, not champs that would be negative for their planned comp/comps.

Irrelevant. Champion select is irrefutably part of ranked. It is designed and meant to be part of the gameplay experience. A team banning a champ that a one trick uses *should* be rewarded. Thus, yes, it is a boon, and they *deserve* that boon. Else the pick/ban phase shouldnt exist in ranked, and you should just get random roles every game. Clearly that is not the case.

The dodge denies the opposing team the boon they rightfully deserve.
